official_title: A bill to direct the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to conduct a comprehensive program of research, technology, and monitoring of the phenomena of the upper atmosphere.
short_title: Upper Atmospheric Research and Monitoring Act

summary.text: Upper Atmospheric Research and Monitoring Act - States that the purpose of this Act is to provide for an understanding of and to maintain the chemical and physical integrity of the Earth's upper atmosphere. Directs the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration in cooperation with other Federal agencies, to initiate and carry out a program of research, technology, monitoring and other appropriate activities directed to understanding the physics and chemistry of the upper atmosphere. Requires the Administrator to arrange for wide participation by the scientific and engineering community in the program authorized by this Act through the use of grants and contracts. Directs the administrator to report annually to the President on his activities and accomplishments pursuant to this Act. Authorizes appropriations of $50,000,000 for fiscal years 1975, 1976, and the three-month transitional period between fiscal year 1976 and 1977 to carry out the purposes of this Act.
